comments.body: do we hit count bug in this case?

Yes, `sum(c2) is null` should return `true` instead `null` in this case.
https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/880bbd6aaaead2ed26dfad38425f4e7357769b6a/sql/core/src/test/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/SubquerySuite.scala#L582-L586

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +94,98 @@
-- COUNT bug without count aggregate
SELECT * FROM t1, LATERAL (SELECT SUM(c2) IS NULL FROM t2 WHERE t1.c1 = t2.c1);

-- COUNT bug with complex aggregate expressions

comments.body:
Could you add tests for more deeply-nested cases? e.g.,
```
SELECT * FROM t1, LATERAL (SELECT t1.*, t2.* FROM t2, LATERAL (SELECT t1.*, t2.*, t3.* FROM t3));
```

Could you activate some tests in `postgreSQL/join.sql`?;
https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/e503b9c462676c381ba51ad48edd968d6e184fc2/sql/core/src/test/resources/sql-tests/inputs/postgreSQL/join.sql#L1278

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@-- Test cases for lateral join

CREATE VIEW t1(c1, c2) AS VALUES (0, 1), (1, 2);

comments.body:
Is this compiled into a join query? We cannot compile it into a simple scan query like PostgreSQL?
```
postgres=# explain SELECT * FROM t1, LATERAL (SELECT c1) t2;
                          QUERY PLAN                          
--------------------------------------------------------------
 Values Scan on "*VALUES*"  (cost=0.00..0.03 rows=2 width=12)
(1 row)
```

> Is this compiled into a join query? We cannot compile it into a simple scan query like PostgreSQL?
> 
> ```
> postgres=# explain SELECT * FROM t1, LATERAL (SELECT c1) t2;
>                           QUERY PLAN                          
> --------------------------------------------------------------
>  Values Scan on "*VALUES*"  (cost=0.00..0.03 rows=2 width=12)
> (1 row)
> ```

Yes it should be rewritten as a simple scan query`SELECT c1 FROM t1` instead of a join query. I am thinking about adding an optimizer rule for OneRowRelation. This can be applied to correlated subqueries as well.

Postgres requires all subqueries in the FROM clause to have aliases, not just lateral, but aliases are not required for subqueries in Spark.
```
select * from (select * from t1);

subquery in FROM must have an alias
```
Could you add tests for `quotedRegexColumnNames`, too?
All star expressions will be handled in a separate PR: SPARK-35618
